item.title: Large potholes in road, 25th January
item.description:
There are several large and deep potholes outside Drawdykes and Holborn Farm, Blacksmith`s Lane.

item.title: Multiple small-medium potholes, 25th January
item.description:
There are multiple potholes and general road crumbling resulting in standing water when raining, which obscure depth of potholes and result in vehicles splashing pedestrians. They are located on Alma Road, between the mini roundabout at Hatherley Road and Chapman Road on the carriageway heading away from Hathrrley Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alma Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole at drop of curb edge of road. Getting wider daily. Several others forming on this side of finch road too, 25th January
item.description:
Outside 14b on edge of road. Started 3-4 mths ago due to heavy traffic begin diverted through estate due to next build estate works. Doubled in size in last 2 weeks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finch Road, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ruined road surface, 25th January
item.description:
The road surface is dreadful where I have marked. There are several patches of wide potholes and it’s only getting worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gretton Road, Prescott, Tewkesbury

item.title: Broken street lamp corner of Laxton Road, 25th January
item.description:
The street light was damaged in a collision. It is still broken with an electrical bag covering it. It’s causing an obstruction to the pavement and lack of street light on that corner.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Laxton Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham

item.title: Blocked drain, 24th January
item.description:
As reported several months ago the drain here is blocked and following moderate to heavy rain water gathers on the surface of the road which not only causes a hazard to pedestrians attempting to use the drop kerb, but also cyclists having to take evasive action and in some cases heading into oncoming traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saint Georges Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollards are not lit - get dirty and present risk to life, 24th January
item.description:
The unlit bollards outside of Gotherington Cross Garage in the carriageway are in a poor state of repair, unlit and are often covered in dirt and as a result cannot often be seen on approach in the dark. With a speed limit of 50mph this presents a serious danger to life. This requires your immediate attention please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Complete bollard is damaged (Non illuminating bollard or post)

item.title: Metal drain cover loose, 24th January
item.description:
Outside number28 Hales road Cheltenham, opposite Rose Hill Street. Metal cover is loose, every car and lorry goes over it. Hales road is a very busy road in constant use all day so the banging is all day and night.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Hales Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Saint Georges Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: 7-8cm pot hole harp hill near junction to Stanley Road, 24th January
item.description:
See photo, just down the hill by junction of Stanley Road and Harp Hill. No properties next to it. Its level to the steps as the pavement finishes. The pothole is alongside/adjacent to the man hole cover.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
